speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: SCENE II. Imogen's bedchamber in Cymbeline's palace:

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: a trunk in one corner of it.

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: IMOGEN in bed, reading; a Lady attending

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Who's there? my woman Helen?

speaker: Lady
text_entry: Please you, madam

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: What hour is it?

speaker: Lady
text_entry: Almost midnight, madam.

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: I have read three hours then: mine eyes are weak:

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Fold down the leaf where I have left: to bed:

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Take not away the taper, leave it burning;

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: And if thou canst awake by four o' the clock,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: I prithee, call me. Sleep hath seized me wholly

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Exit Lady

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: To your protection I commend me, gods.

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: From fairies and the tempters of the night

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Guard me, beseech ye.

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Sleeps. IACHIMO comes from the trunk

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: The crickets sing, and man's o'er-labour'd sense

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Repairs itself by rest. Our Tarquin thus

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Did softly press the rushes, ere he waken'd

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: The chastity he wounded. Cytherea,

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: How bravely thou becomest thy bed, fresh lily,

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: And whiter than the sheets! That I might touch!

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: But kiss; one kiss! Rubies unparagon'd,

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: How dearly they do't! 'Tis her breathing that

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Perfumes the chamber thus: the flame o' the taper

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Bows toward her, and would under-peep her lids,

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: To see the enclosed lights, now canopied

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Under these windows, white and azure laced

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: With blue of heaven's own tinct. But my design,

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: To note the chamber: I will write all down:

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Such and such pictures; there the window; such

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: The adornment of her bed; the arras; figures,

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Why, such and such; and the contents o' the story.

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Ah, but some natural notes about her body,

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Above ten thousand meaner moveables

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Would testify, to enrich mine inventory.

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: O sleep, thou ape of death, lie dull upon her!

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: And be her sense but as a monument,

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Thus in a chapel lying! Come off, come off:

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Taking off her bracelet

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: As slippery as the Gordian knot was hard!

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: 'Tis mine; and this will witness outwardly,

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: As strongly as the conscience does within,

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: To the madding of her lord. On her left breast

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: A mole cinque-spotted, like the crimson drops

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: I' the bottom of a cowslip: here's a voucher,

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Stronger than ever law could make: this secret

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Will force him think I have pick'd the lock and ta'en

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: The treasure of her honour. No more. To what end?

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Why should I write this down, that's riveted,

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Screw'd to my memory? She hath been reading late

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: The tale of Tereus; here the leaf's turn'd down

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Where Philomel gave up. I have enough:

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: To the trunk again, and shut the spring of it.

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Swift, swift, you dragons of the night, that dawning

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: May bare the raven's eye! I lodge in fear;

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Though this a heavenly angel, hell is here.

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Clock strikes

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: One, two, three: time, time!
An ante-chamber adjoining Imogen's apartments.
Enter CLOTEN and Lords

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: Your lordship is the most patient man in loss, the

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: most coldest that ever turned up ace.

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: It would make any man cold to lose.

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: But not every man patient after the noble temper of

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: your lordship. You are most hot and furious when you win.

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Winning will put any man into courage. If I could

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: get this foolish Imogen, I should have gold enough.

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: It's almost morning, is't not?

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: Day, my lord.

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: I would this music would come: I am advised to give

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: her music o' mornings; they say it will penetrate.

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Enter Musicians

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Come on; tune: if you can penetrate her with your

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: fingering, so; we'll try with tongue too: if none

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: will do, let her remain; but I'll never give o'er.

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: First, a very excellent good-conceited thing;

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: after, a wonderful sweet air, with admirable rich

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: words to it: and then let her consider.

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: SONG

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Hark, hark! the lark at heaven's gate sings,

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: And Phoebus 'gins arise,

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: His steeds to water at those springs

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: On chaliced flowers that lies;

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: And winking Mary-buds begin

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: To ope their golden eyes:

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: With every thing that pretty is,

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: My lady sweet, arise:

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Arise, arise.

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: So, get you gone. If this penetrate, I will

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: consider your music the better: if it do not, it is

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: a vice in her ears, which horse-hairs and

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: calves'-guts, nor the voice of unpaved eunuch to

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: boot, can never amend.

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Exeunt Musicians

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: Here comes the king.

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: I am glad I was up so late; for that's the reason I

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: was up so early: he cannot choose but take this

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: service I have done fatherly.

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Enter CYMBELINE and QUEEN

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Good morrow to your majesty and to my gracious mother.

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Attend you here the door of our stern daughter?

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Will she not forth?

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: I have assailed her with music, but she vouchsafes no notice.

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: The exile of her minion is too new;

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: She hath not yet forgot him: some more time

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Must wear the print of his remembrance out,

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: And then she's yours.

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: You are most bound to the king,

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Who lets go by no vantages that may

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Prefer you to his daughter. Frame yourself

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: To orderly soliciting, and be friended

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: With aptness of the season; make denials

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Increase your services; so seem as if

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: You were inspired to do those duties which

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: You tender to her; that you in all obey her,

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Save when command to your dismission tends,

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: And therein you are senseless.

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Senseless! not so.

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Enter a Messenger

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: So like you, sir, ambassadors from Rome;

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: The one is Caius Lucius.

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: A worthy fellow,

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Albeit he comes on angry purpose now;

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: But that's no fault of his: we must receive him

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: According to the honour of his sender;

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: And towards himself, his goodness forespent on us,

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: We must extend our notice. Our dear son,

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: When you have given good morning to your mistress,

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Attend the queen and us; we shall have need

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: To employ you towards this Roman. Come, our queen.

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Exeunt all but CLOTEN

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: If she be up, I'll speak with her; if not,

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Let her lie still and dream.

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Knocks

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: By your leave, ho!

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: I Know her women are about her: what

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: If I do line one of their hands? 'Tis gold

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Which buys admittance; oft it doth; yea, and makes

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Diana's rangers false themselves, yield up

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Their deer to the stand o' the stealer; and 'tis gold

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Which makes the true man kill'd and saves the thief;

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Nay, sometime hangs both thief and true man: what

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Can it not do and undo? I will make

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: One of her women lawyer to me, for

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: I yet not understand the case myself.

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Knocks

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: By your leave.

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Enter a Lady

speaker: Lady
text_entry: Who's there that knocks?

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: A gentleman.

speaker: Lady
text_entry: No more?

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Yes, and a gentlewoman's son.

speaker: Lady
text_entry: That's more

speaker: Lady
text_entry: Than some, whose tailors are as dear as yours,

speaker: Lady
text_entry: Can justly boast of. What's your lordship's pleasure?

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Your lady's person: is she ready?

speaker: Lady
text_entry: Ay,

speaker: Lady
text_entry: To keep her chamber.

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: There is gold for you;

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Sell me your good report.

speaker: Lady
text_entry: How! my good name? or to report of you

speaker: Lady
text_entry: What I shall think is good?--The princess!

speaker: Lady
text_entry: Enter IMOGEN

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Good morrow, fairest: sister, your sweet hand.

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Exit Lady

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Good morrow, sir. You lay out too much pains

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: For purchasing but trouble; the thanks I give

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Is telling you that I am poor of thanks

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: And scarce can spare them.

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Still, I swear I love you.

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: If you but said so, 'twere as deep with me:

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: If you swear still, your recompense is still

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: That I regard it not.

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: This is no answer.

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: But that you shall not say I yield being silent,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: I would not speak. I pray you, spare me: 'faith,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: I shall unfold equal discourtesy

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: To your best kindness: one of your great knowing

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Should learn, being taught, forbearance.

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: To leave you in your madness, 'twere my sin:

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: I will not.

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Fools are not mad folks.

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Do you call me fool?

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: As I am mad, I do:

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: If you'll be patient, I'll no more be mad;

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: That cures us both. I am much sorry, sir,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: You put me to forget a lady's manners,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: By being so verbal: and learn now, for all,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: That I, which know my heart, do here pronounce,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: By the very truth of it, I care not for you,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: And am so near the lack of charity--

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: To accuse myself--I hate you; which I had rather

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: You felt than make't my boast.

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: You sin against

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Obedience, which you owe your father. For

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: The contract you pretend with that base wretch,

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: One bred of alms and foster'd with cold dishes,

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: With scraps o' the court, it is no contract, none:

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: And though it be allow'd in meaner parties--

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Yet who than he more mean?--to knit their souls,

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: On whom there is no more dependency

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: But brats and beggary, in self-figured knot;

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Yet you are curb'd from that enlargement by

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: The consequence o' the crown, and must not soil

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: The precious note of it with a base slave.

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: A hilding for a livery, a squire's cloth,

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: A pantler, not so eminent.

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Profane fellow

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Wert thou the son of Jupiter and no more

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: But what thou art besides, thou wert too base

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: To be his groom: thou wert dignified enough,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Even to the point of envy, if 'twere made

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Comparative for your virtues, to be styled

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: The under-hangman of his kingdom, and hated

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: For being preferred so well.

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: The south-fog rot him!

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: He never can meet more mischance than come

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: To be but named of thee. His meanest garment,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: That ever hath but clipp'd his body, is dearer

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: In my respect than all the hairs above thee,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Were they all made such men. How now, Pisanio!

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Enter PISANIO

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: 'His garment!' Now the devil--

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: To Dorothy my woman hie thee presently--

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: 'His garment!'

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: I am sprited with a fool.

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Frighted, and anger'd worse: go bid my woman

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Search for a jewel that too casually

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Hath left mine arm: it was thy master's: 'shrew me,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: If I would lose it for a revenue

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Of any king's in Europe. I do think

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: I saw't this morning: confident I am

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Last night 'twas on mine arm; I kiss'd it:

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: I hope it be not gone to tell my lord

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: That I kiss aught but he.

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: 'Twill not be lost.

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: I hope so: go and search.

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Exit PISANIO

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: You have abused me:

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: 'His meanest garment!'

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Ay, I said so, sir:

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: If you will make't an action, call witness to't.

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: I will inform your father.

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Your mother too:

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: She's my good lady, and will conceive, I hope,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: But the worst of me. So, I leave you, sir,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: To the worst of discontent.

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Exit

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: I'll be revenged:

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: 'His meanest garment!' Well.

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Exit

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: CYMBELINE

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: SCENE IV. Rome. Philario's house.

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Enter POSTHUMUS and PHILARIO
